intro: Echioglossum sacculatum, commonly known as the bladder orchid, is a flowering plant native to the southern regions of Australia. It is characterized by its unique, pouch-like structure at the base of its flower, which is a distinctive botanical feature. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and thrives in dry, sunny environments. Its flowers are usually pale yellow or greenish in color, and it produces small, rounded seed pods. Echioglossum sacculatum is a perennial herb that plays a role in the ecological diversity of its native habitats.
